mask.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it
mask.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He was attacked and robbed by two people wearing masks.
mask.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: something that covers your face, and has another face painted on it, which is used for ceremonies or special occasions
mask.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: an expression or way of behaving that hides your real emotions or character
mask.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Her sarcasm is a mask for her insecurity.
mask.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a substance that you put on your face and leave there for a short time to clean the skin or make it softer
mask.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if a smell, taste, sound etc is masked by a stronger one, it cannot be noticed because of the stronger one
mask.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Liz turned on a radio to mask the noise.
Air-fresheners mask bad smells instead of removing them.
mask.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation
mask.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Men often mask their true feelings with humour.
mask.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to cover or hide something so that it cannot be clearly seen
mask.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The new accommodation block has all but masked the original building.
